name: Message
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Message
description:
Message

Represents a Pub/Sub Message.

Message objects are created by Topic#publish. Subscription#pull returns an array of ReceivedMessage objects, each of which contains a Message object. Each ReceivedMessage object can be acknowledged and/or delayed.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

# Publish a message
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
message = topic.publish "task completed"
message.data #=> "task completed"

# Pull a message
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
received_message = sub.pull.first
received_message.message.data #=> "task completed"

methods.name: initialize
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Message#initialize
methods.description: Create an empty Message object. This can be used to publish several messages in bulk.

methods.name: data
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Message#data
methods.description: The message payload. This data is a list of bytes encoded as ASCII-8BIT.

methods.name: message_id
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Message#message_id
methods.description: The ID of this message, assigned by the server at publication time. Guaranteed to be unique within the topic.

methods.name: published_at
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Message#published_at
methods.description: The time at which the message was published.
